verb.description: (of something restrictive or too tight) make (a part of the body) sore by rubbing against it.
Rub (a part of the body) to restore warmth or sensation.
Become or make annoyed or impatient because of a restriction or inconvenience.
examples: the bank chafed at the restrictions imposed upon it
it chafed him to be confined like this

noun.description: Wear or damage caused by rubbing.
examples: to prevent chafe the ropes should lie flat

phrases: the players are chafing at the bit for a game
the prospective students from Boston were chafing at the bit to start grad school
origin: Late Middle English (in the sense make warm): from Old French chaufer make hot, based on Latin calefacere, from calere be hot + facere make.
